text: Barnard is a city in Lincoln County, Kansas, United States. In 2020, 64 people lived there. ==History== Barnard was first settled in 1888. It was incorporated as a city in 1904. Barnard was named for J.F. Barnard, a railroad employee. ==Geography== Barnard is at (39.189171, -98.044252). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . All of it is land. ===Weather=== Barnard has hot, humid summers and generally mild to cool winters. The KÃ¶ppen Climate Classification system says that Barnard has a humid subtropical climate, abbreviated "Cfa" on climate maps.Climate Summary for Barnard, Kansas ==People== ===2020 census=== The 2020 census says that there were 64 people, 34 households, and 18 families living in Barnard. The median age was 60.0 years. Of the people, 85.9% were White, 1.6% were Pacific Islanders, and 12.5% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 3.1% of the people. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 70 people, 43 households, and 16 families living in Barnard. ==Education== Barnard is part of USD 298 Lincoln. Barnard schools were closed through school unification. The Barnard High School mascot was Cardinals."Barnard Classes to be Graduated", The Salina Journal, 17 May 1951, p.21. ==References== ==Other websites== ;City * Barnard - Directory of Public Officials ;Schools * USD 298, local school district ;Historical * History of Barnard, Legends of Kansas ;Maps * Barnard City Map , KDOT Category:Cities in Kansas Category:1888 establishments in Kansas Category:Lincoln County, Kansas
title: Barnard, Kansas
